newsitem.title: JAPAN: Bandai targets 10 bln yen sales from "virtual pet".
newsitem.headline: Bandai targets 10 bln yen sales from "virtual pet".

text.p: Bandai Co Ltd said on Thursday it is targeting a total of 10 billion yen in sales of its "virtual pet" toys for the next fiscal year ending March 1998.

Bandai began selling "tamagocchi", an electronic bird-like creature the size of an egg, on November 23. The digital pet can be fed, stroked and goes to the bathroom just like a live pet and will die if neglected.

A Bandai spokesman said the company plans to launch a new version of the virtual pet and other related goods in February. The company forecast that cumulative shipments of its virtual pets would total three million units by April and six million by June. It has already shipped 550,000 units.
Bandai announced earlier on Thursday that it would merge with Sega Enterprises Ltd on October 1, creating a formidable new world force in the toy and videogame market.
